ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The opinion others have of me is based on my appearance.
The amount of influence I have on other people depends upon how I look.
People will think less of me if I don't look my best.
People would be more interested in me if I looked better.
My relationships would improve if I looked the way I wished.
The amount of success I have in my (future) job or career depends largely upon how I look.
My appearance influences my ability to do things.
My performance in activities (e.g., school, work, hobbies) is influenced by how I look.
The opportunities that are available to me depend upon how I look.
My school and/or work performance or opportunities would improve if I looked the way I wished.
My value as a person depends upon how I look.
How I feel about myself is largely based on my appearance.
I would think more highly of myself if I looked the way I wished.
How I look is a large part of who I am.
It is difficult to feel good about myself when I am not looking my best.
My ability to feel happy depends upon how I look.
Improving my appearance is one of the few activities that makes me feel good or like I am accomplishing something.
My life will be more exciting or rewarding if I look good.
My moods are influenced by how I look.
I would enjoy life more if I looked the way I wished.
